ALGEE: The Youth Mental Health First Aid Action Plan

ALGEE is a five-step action plan for providing Mental Health First Aid to young people experiencing mental health challenges or crises.

A - Approach, Assess, Assist
• Approach the young person in a caring, non-threatening manner
• Assess for risk of suicide or harm
• Listen non-judgmentally
• Assist in seeking appropriate professional help if needed

L - Listen Non-Judgmentally
• Give the person your full attention
• Maintain appropriate eye contact
• Use open body language
• Don't interrupt or rush to solutions
• Avoid judgmental statements
• Validate their feelings

G - Give Support and Information
• Provide emotional support
• Offer reassurance and hope
• Share relevant information about mental health
• Explain that help is available
• Be patient with their process

E - Encourage Appropriate Professional Help
• Suggest professional support options
• Discuss types of help available
• Offer to help them find resources
• Follow up on whether they sought help
• Respect their choices while providing guidance

E - Encourage Self-Help and Other Support Strategies
• Suggest self-care activities
• Connect them to support groups
• Involve family or friends if appropriate
• Discuss healthy coping strategies
• Follow up to see how they're doing

Key Principles:
- The plan is flexible, not always linear
- Some steps may be repeated
- Professional help is crucial for serious conditions
- Cultural sensitivity is important throughout
